00024 #include <amber_rst.hpp>
00025 #include <AtomicGroup.hpp>
00026 #include <iomanip>
00027 #include <sstream>
00028 
00029 namespace loos {

00032 
00033   bool AmberRst::parseFrame(void) {
00034     std::string buf;
00035     greal x, y, z;
00036 
00037     // Skip the title...
00038     std::getline(*(ifs()), buf);
00039     if (ifs()->eof())
00040       return(false);   //  Catch the initial EOF...
00041 
00042     // Check the # of atoms...
00043     // Note: the Amber spec says that this line should contain both
00044     // the number of atoms and the current time, but some restart
00045     // files "in the wild" only have the number of atoms...
00046     std::getline(*(ifs()), buf);
00047     std::istringstream iss(buf);
00048     uint na;
00049     iss >> na;
00050     if (na != _natoms)
00051       throw(LOOSError("Number of atoms mismatch in Amber restart file"));
00052 
00053     iss >> current_time;
00054 
00055 
00056     // This should probably be in an initialization rather than here...???
00057     frame.reserve(na);
00058 
00059     uint i;
00060     for (i=0; i<_natoms && !(ifs()->eof()); ++i) {
00061       *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> x >> std::setw(12) >> y >> std::setw(12) >> z;
00062       frame[i] = GCoord(x, y, z);
00063     }
00064 
00065     if (i != _natoms)
00066       throw(LOOSError("Number of atoms read is not what was expected"));
00067 
00068     // Probe for velocities or periodic box...
00069     greal a, b, c;
00070     *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> a >> std::setw(12) >> b >> std::setw(12) >> c;
00071     if (ifs()->eof())
00072       return(true);
00073 
00074     // Finish reading the putative box...
00075     *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> x >> std::setw(12) >> y >> std::setw(12) >> z;
00076 
00077     // Check to see if there are more numbers...  If so, implies we're
00078     // in velocities...
00079     *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> x >> std::setw(12) >> y >> std::setw(12) >> z;
00080 
00081     if (ifs()->eof()) {
00082       periodic = true;
00083       box = GCoord(a, b, c);
00084       return(true);
00085     }
00086 
00087     // This means we probably have velocities, so now we have to skip
00088     // the appropriate # of atoms and try again for the box...
00089 
00090     for (uint i=3; i<_natoms && !(ifs()->eof()); ++i)
00091       *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> x >> std::setw(12) >> y >> std::setw(12) >> z;
00092 
00093     // Now read the box in...
00094     *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> a >> std::setw(12) >> b >> std::setw(12) >> c;
00095     *(ifs()) >> std::setw(12) >> x >> std::setw(12) >> y >> std::setw(12) >> z;
00096 
00097     if (ifs()->eof() || ifs()->fail())
00098       return(true);
00099 
00100     periodic = true;
00101     box = GCoord(a, b, c);
00102 
00103     return(true);
00104   }
00105 
00106 
00107 
00108   void AmberRst::updateGroupCoords(AtomicGroup& g) {
00109     AtomicGroup::iterator gi;
00110     pAtom pa;
00111 
00112 
00113     for (gi = g.begin(); gi != g.end(); ++gi) {
00114       uint i = (*gi)->id() - 1;
00115       if (i >= _natoms)
00116         throw(std::runtime_error("Attempting to index a nonexistent atom in AmberTraj::updateGroupCoords()"));
00117       (*gi)->coords(frame[i]);
00118     }
00119 
00120     if (periodic)
00121       g.periodicBox(box);
00122   }
00123 
00124 
00125   void AmberRst::seekNextFrameImpl(void) {
00126     if (!seek_flag) {
00127       seek_flag = true;
00128       return;
00129     }
00130 
00131     throw(std::logic_error("Amber RST files cannot be seeked beyond the first frame"));
00132   }
00133 
00134   void AmberRst::seekFrameImpl(const uint i) {
00135     if (i != 0)
00136       throw(std::logic_error("Amber RST files cannot be seeked beyond the first frame"));
00137   }
00138 }
